body.head: A gentle introduction to the TEI
body.p: EPIDOC is derived from the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), a general framework for defining scholarly mark-up systems, which is the current de facto standard for text digitization in the digital humanities. This two day course aims to provide a simple introduction to the TEI as a basis for a more detailed complementary training in the use of EPIDOC.

div.head: Important notice
div.p: One of the main objectives of this course is to give you some practical experience with XML editing software. For this purpose, the practical sessions will be using a friendly but powerful piece of software called Oxygen, available for Windows, Mac, or Linux. This is commercial software, but there is a free trial system which you can download and use for sixty days without cost.

Before the course begins please visit the web site http://www.oxygenxml.com/download.html, download the version of OxyGen appropriate for your laptop, and install it. If you already have it installed, please check that you have the most recent version (13.x).
For the practical part of the course, you will also need to download your own copy of the sample working files.
